description: cast +‎ -er; the wheel sense comes from obsolete cast (“to turn”).

examples: an online caster of video games

entries.meaning: A wheeled assembly attached to a larger object at its base to facilitate rolling. A caster usually consists of a wheel (which may be plastic, a hard elastomer, or metal), an axle, a mounting provision (usually a stem, flange, or plate), and sometimes a swivel (which allows the caster to rotate for steering).
examples: Many office chairs roll on a set of casters.

entries.meaning: A shaker with a perforated top for sprinkling condiments such as sugar, salt, pepper, etc.
A stand to hold a set of shakers or cruets.
(automotive) The angle of the axis around which a car's front wheels rotate when the steering wheel is turned, with a vertical axis being defined as zero caster.

verbs.description: caster (third-person singular simple present casters, present participle castering, simple past and past participle castered)
